en: They will see the Lord face to face, and his name will be written on their foreheads. It will never be night again and they will not need lamplight or sunlight, because the Lord God will be shining on them. They will reign for ever and ever.
la: Et videbunt faciem ejus, et nomen ejus in frontibus eorum. Et nox ultra non erit, neque opus habebunt lumine lucernae neque lumine solis, quoniam Dominus Deus illuminabit illos, et regnabunt in saecula saeculorum.

en: They will see his face, and his name will be on their foreheads. And there will be no more night; they need no light of lamp or sun, for the Lord God will be their light, and they will reign forever and ever.
God destined us not for wrath but for obtaining salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ, who died for us, so that whether we are awake or asleep we may live with him.
la: Quoniam non posuit nos Deus in iram, sed in acquisitionem salutis per Dominum nostrum Jesum Christum, qui mortuus est pro nobis, ut sive vigilemus sive dormiamus, simul cum illo vivamus.

en: For God has destined us not for wrath but for obtaining salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ, who died for us, so that whether we are awake or asleep we may live with him.
Discipline yourselves, keep alert. Like a roaring lion your adversary the devil prowls around, looking for someone to devour. Resist him, steadfast in your faith.
la: Sobrii estote, vigilate. Adversarius vester diabolus tamquam leo rugiens circuit, quaerens quem devoret; cui resistite fortes in fide.

en: Be angry but do not sin; do not let the sun go down on your anger, and do not make room for the devil.
la: Irascimini, et nolite peccare: sol non occidat super iracundiam vestram. Nolite locum dare diabolo.

en: Those of steadfast mind you keep in peaceâ€”in peace because they trust in you. Trust in the Lord forever, for in the Lord God you have an everlasting rock.
la: Vetus cogitatio permanebit; pax, pax, quia in te speravimus. Sperate in Domino usque in aeternum, in Domino Deo fortitudine saeculorum.

en: Yet you, O Lord, are in the midst of us, and we are called by your name; do not forsake us!
la: Tu autem in nobis es, Domine, et nomen tuum invocatum est super nos; ne derelinquas nos.

en: See what love the Father has given us, that we should be called children of God; and that is what we are. Beloved, we are God's children now; what we will be has not yet been revealed.
la: Videte qualem caritatem dedit nobis Pater, ut filii Dei nominemur et simus. Carissimi, nunc filii Dei sumus; et nondum apparuit quid erimus.
